title: Can I directly learn C++ instead of learning C to save time? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, you can and better to refine skill more on logic building initially. Logic building skills builds confidence and interest in programming and it doesn’t require much of technical stuffs. Later on try to learn features of C++. Please refer the following post for learning logic building skills in an interesting way. How can I improve my programming skills?

Yes, C++ is just a superset of C with additional OOPs concept added to C  . You will be surprised to know that the initial name of C++ was “C with classes” later on it was changed to C++ indicating C is incremented (or updated). In fact, many people learn about C procedural paradigm via C++.

Yes you can learn C++ without first learning C. However, note that it won't save you a lot of time, because literally all C concepts are part of C++, plus it has more. So, effectively you'll end up in learning C concepts.
Yes, and it is the best way to effectively learn C++ for what it is supposed to be, and not as “an extension of C” like anyone not following the C++ evolution since more than 10 year use to say.
